name: introduce
posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: introduce
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to put something into use, operation, or a place for the first time
trans_examp.trans_cn: 采用；引进；推行；放入，插入

example.eg: Apple has sold many millions of iPods since the product was introduced in 2001.
example.egtrans: 自从2001年首次推出该产品以来，苹果公司已经售出了成百上千万台iPod。

example.eg: Such unpopular legislation is unlikely to be introduced before the next election.
example.egtrans: 如此不受欢迎的立法不可能在下次选举之前提出。

example.eg: The tube which carries the laser is introduced into the abdomen through a small cut in the skin.
example.egtrans: 传送激光的导管通过皮肤上的小切口插入腹部。

dsense.name: introduce
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to tell someone another person's name the first time that they meet

example.eg: I'd like to introduce my son, Mark.
example.egtrans: 我想介绍一下我的儿子马克。

example.eg: Have you two been introduced (to each other)?

dsense.name: introduce
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to be the beginning of something

example.eg: A haunting oboe solo introduces the third movement of the concerto.
example.egtrans: 协奏曲第三乐章以一段摄人心魄的双簧管独奏开始。

trans_examp.trans_en: to speak or write before the beginning of a performance, programme or book and give information about it; to tell an audience about the person who is going to speak, sing, etc.

example.eg: The director will introduce the film personally at its premiere.
example.egtrans: 导演将在这部影片的全球首映式上亲自推介该片。

example.eg: This is the first official biography of her and it is introduced by her daughter.
example.egtrans: 这是她的第一部正式传记，由其女儿作序。

example.eg: I'd now like to introduce our next guest, who will be singing songs from her latest album.
example.egtrans: 现在我想介绍我们的下一位嘉宾，她将为我们演唱她最新大碟里的歌曲。
